meaning: a division or contrast between two things that are or are represented as being opposed or entirely different.
modesty or shyness resulting from a lack of self-confidence.
spread over a wide area or between a large number of people.
spread out over a large area; not concentrated.
lacking clarity or conciseness.
a temporary departure from the main subject in speech or writing.
a lament for the dead, especially one forming part of a funeral rite.
persuade (someone) that an idea or belief is mistaken.
having or showing good judgement.
recognize or find out.
disagreeing or incongruous.
(of sounds) harsh and jarring because of a lack of harmony.
harm the good reputation of.
loss or lack of reputation or respect.
an illogical or surprising lack of compatibility or similarity between two or more facts.
individually separate and distinct.
not candid or sincere, typically by pretending that one knows less about something than one really does.
not influenced by considerations of personal advantage.
having or feeling no interest in something; uninterested.
lacking a coherent sequence or connection.
disturb the cohesion or organization of.
order or allow to leave; send away.
treat as unworthy of serious consideration.
regard or represent as being of little worth.
things so unlike that there is no basis for comparison.
essentially different in kind; not able to be compared.
conceal or disguise one's true feelings or beliefs.
spread (something, especially information) widely.
debauched living; dissipation.
the action of formally ending or dismissing an assembly, partnership, or official body.
example: a rigid dichotomy between science and mysticism
I say this with some diffidence
technologies diffuse rapidly
the diffuse community which centred on the church
the second argument is more diffuse
let's return to the main topic after that brief digression
he wrote dirges for funerals
he quickly disabused me of my fanciful notions
the brasserie attracts discerning customers
I can discern no difference between the two policies
the operative principle of democracy is a balance of discordant qualities
the singers continued their discordant chanting
his remarks were taken out of context in an effort to discredit him
they committed crimes which brought discredit upon the administration
there's a discrepancy between your account and his
speech sounds are produced as a continuous sound signal rather than discrete units
this journalist was being somewhat disingenuous as well as cynical
a banker is under an obligation to give disinterested advice
her father was so disinterested in her progress that he only visited the school once
piecing together disjointed fragments of information
the loss of the area disjointed military plans
she dismissed the taxi at the corner of the road
it would be easy to dismiss him as all brawn and no brain
he never missed an opportunity to disparage his competitors
they inhabit disparate worlds of thought
an honest, sincere person with no need to dissemble
health authorities should foster good practice by disseminating information
an advanced state of dissolution
the dissolution of their marriage
